Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a plant that has access to water, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can illustrate a plant without water, showing it as wilting or not growing well.
The student can show the difference between a plant that is thriving with sunlight and one that is in a dark place and not growing well.
The student can include visual patterns showing the role of water in plant growth, such as comparing a green healthy plant to a dried out one.
The student can create a chart or picture that organizes observations about how plants look with or without water.
The student can identify and illustrate the relationship between the presence of water and plant health.
